description: Perhaps after Byzantine Ancient Greek ὀμφαλοειδής (omphaloeidḗs); surface analysis, omphal- +‎ -oid.

adjectives.description: omphaloid (comparative more omphaloid, superlative most omphaloid)

examples: Constructed in a navel-like depression of hills, Bath's omphaloid location induces introspection, meditation, inwardness, massive sloth.
